content: There are about 30 species of [amphibians](/wiki/Amphibian) in Singapore. Amphibians are aquatic vertebrates. They need water to survive. They include frogs, toads, newts, salamanders and caecilians. But Singapore does not have newts and salamanders. The most common amphibians one is likely to encounter are the [Asian toad](/wiki/Bufo_melanostictus) and [banded bullfrog](/wiki/Kaloula_pulchra). Some species are common in forested areas, like the [black-eyed litter frog](/wiki/Kalophrynus_pleurostigma). ## List of amphibians ### Order [Anura](/wiki/Anura_(frog)) (frogs and toads) #### Family [Bufonidae](/wiki/Bufonidae) (toads) - Asian toad (*[Duttaphrynus melanostictus](/wiki/Bufo_melanostictus)*) - Common - Singapore Island, Sentosa, Pulau Semakau, Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong - Four-ridged toad (*[Ingerophrynus quadriporcatus](/wiki/Bufo_quadriporcatus)*) - Common - Central Catchment Nature Reserve, Western Catchment, Pulau Tekong - Saint Andrew's Cross toadlet (*[Pelophryne ingeri](/wiki/Pelophryne_ingeri)*) - Rare - Bukit Timah Nature Reserve #### Family [Megophryidae](/wiki/Megophryidae) (litter frogs) - Black-eyed litter frog (*[Leptobrachium nigrops](/wiki/Leptobrachium_nigrops)*) - Common - Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, Central Catchment Nature Reserve - Malayan horned frog (*[Pelobatrachus nasutus](/wiki/Pelobatrachus_nasutus)*) - Rare - Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, Central Catchment Nature Reserve #### Family [Dicroglossidae](/wiki/Dicroglossidae) (fanged frogs) - Crab-eating frog (*[Fejervarya cancrivora](/wiki/Fejervarya_cancrivora)*) - Common - Singapore Island, Sentosa, Pulau Semakau, Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong - Field frog (*[Fejervarya limnocharis](/wiki/Fejervarya_limnocharis)*) - Common - Singapore Island, Sentosa, Pulau Semakau, Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong - Malayan giant frog (*[Limnonectes blythii](/wiki/Limnonectes_blythii)*) - Uncommon - Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, Bukit Batok, Bukit Gombak, Central Catchment Nature Reserve, Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve, Western Catchment, Singapore Botanic Gardens, Admiralty Park, Clementi Forest - Malesian frog (*[Limnonectes malesianus](/wiki/Limnonectes_malesianus)*) - Uncommon - Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, Central Catchment Nature Reserve, Western Catchment - Masked swamp frog (*[Limnonectes paramacrodon](/wiki/Limnonectes_paramacrodon)*) - Rare - Central Catchment Nature Reserve, Pulau Tekong - Rhinoceros frog (*[Limnonectes plicatellus](/wiki/Limnonectes_plicatellus)*) - Rare - Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, Central Catchment Nature Reserve - Yellow-bellied puddle frog (*[Occidozyga sumatrana](/wiki/Occidozyga_sumatrana)*) - Uncommon - Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, Central Catchment Nature Reserve, Western Catchment, Pulau Tekong #### Family [Ranidae](/wiki/Ranidae) (true frogs) - Copper-cheeked frog (*[Chalcorana labialis](/wiki/Chalcorana_labialis)*) - Common - Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, Central Catchment Nature Reserve, Western Catchment, Pulau Tekong - Common greenback (*[Hylarana erythraea](/wiki/Hylarana_erythraea)*) - Common - Singapore Island, Sentosa, Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong - Golden-eared rough-sided frog (*[Pulchrana baramica](/wiki/Pulchrana_baramica)*) - Uncommon - Central Catchment Nature Reserve, Pulau Tekong - Masked rough-sided frog (*[Pulchrana laterimaculata](/wiki/Pulchrana_laterimaculata)*) - Common - Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, Central Catchment Nature Reserve, Holland Woods, Pulau Tekong (unconfirmed) - American bullfrog (*[Lithobates catesbeianus](/wiki/Lithobates_catesbeianus)*) - Introduced - GÃ¼nther's frog (*[Sylvirana guentheri](/wiki/Sylvirana_guentheri)*) - Introduced - Singapore Island #### Family [Rhacophoridae](/wiki/Rhacophoridae) (gliding frogs) - Cinnamon bush frog (*[Nyctixalus pictus](/wiki/Nyctixalus_pictus)*) - Rare - Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, Central Catchment Nature Reserve, Singapore Botanic Gardens - Four-lined tree frog (*[Polypedates leucomystax](/wiki/Polypedates_leucomystax)*) - Common - Singapore Island, Sentosa, Lazarus Island, Pulau Semakau, Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong - Blue-spotted tree frog (*[Leptomantis cyanopunctatus](/wiki/Blue-spotted_tree_frog)*) - Rare - Central Catchment Nature Reserve - Thorny tree frog (*[Theloderma horridum](/wiki/Theloderma_horridum)*) - Rare - Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, Central Catchment Nature Reserve #### Family [Microhylidae](/wiki/Microhylidae) (narrow-mouthed frogs) - Lim's black-spotted sticky frog (*Kalophrynus limbooliati*) - Uncommon - Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, Central Catchment Nature Reserve, Sentosa - Banded bullfrog (*[Kaloula pulchra](/wiki/Kaloula_pulchra)*) - Introduced - Singapore Island, Sentosa, St. John's Island, Lazarus Island, Pulau Semakau, Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong - Painted chorus frog (*[Microhyla butleri](/wiki/Microhyla_butleri)*) - Common - Singapore Island, Sentosa, Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong - Dark-sided chorus frog (*[Microhyla heymonsi](/wiki/Microhyla_heymonsi)*) - Common - Singapore Island, Sentosa, Pulau Ubin, Pulau Tekong - Mukhlesur's chorus frog (*Microhyla mukhlesuri*) - Introduced - Singapore Island, Sentosa, Pulau Tekong - Manthey's chorus frog (*[Microhyla mantheyi](/wiki/Microhyla_mantheyi)*) - Rare - Central Catchment Nature Reserve - Subaraj's paddy frog (*Micryletta subaraji*) - Rare - Kranji, Central Catchment Nature Reserve #### Family [Hylidae](/wiki/Hylidae) (tree frogs) - Australian green tree frog (*[Ranoidea caerulea](/wiki/Ranoidea_caerulea)*) - Escapee - Lim Chu Kang #### Family [Eleutherodactylidae](/wiki/Eleutherodactylidae) (rain frogs) - Greenhouse frog (*[Eleutherodactylus planirostris](/wiki/Eleutherodactylus_planirostris)*) - Introduced - Singapore Island, Sentosa ### Order [Gymnophiona](/wiki/Gymnophiona) (caecilians) #### Family [Ichthyophiidae](/wiki/Ichthyophiidae) (Asian caecilians) - Yellow-banded caecilian (*[Ichthyophis paucisulcus](/wiki/Ichthyophis_paucisulcus)*) - Rare - Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, Central Catchment Nature Reserve - Singapore Black caecilian (*[Ichthyophis singaporensis](/wiki/Ichthyophis_singaporensis)*) - Status uncertain - [List of mammals of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_mammals_of_Singapore) - [List of birds of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_birds_of_Singapore) - [List of reptiles of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_reptiles_of_Singapore) - https://web.archive.org/web/20080411071427/http://www.wildsingapore.per.sg/discovery/Amphibian.htm - http://www.ecologyasia.com/verts/amphibians.htm - https://anura-in-singapore.blogspot.com/ - Amphibian and Reptiles of Peninsular Malaysia
title: List of amphibians of Singapore
